message.content:
cs.NI, cs.MM, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.CR 

The paper focuses on the infrastructure deployment of a content hypergiant, Netflix, and its Content Delivery Network (CDN). It studies the role of Internet Exchange Points (IXPs) in enabling large-scale content delivery and reaching a worldwide customer base. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also analyzes the traffic levels at IXPs and ISPs across various local ecosystems, which falls under cs.MM (Multimedia). Additionally, the paper discusses the complexity of large-scale content delivery, which can be categorized under cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the paper also touches upon the security implications of content delivery, which can be classified under cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
